plot: Mary receives help from a former foe to keep Salem in the grasp of the witches.

Dr. Samuel Wainwright treats and studies the plague victims, puzzling even Mary with his prospective blood cure and theory that the soul is located in the pancreas. With the ambitious town treasure claiming to succeed the magistrate, urgently needed to deal with witchcraft suspects, Mary Sibley plant to impose her ex-servant puppet Corwin, but lacks the authority to compel the own council, so she offers husband George his body control back as reward, but masked John Alden seizes and tortures Corwin, who never arrives. Revered Cotton Mather returns, accompanied by a powerful witch, past the corrupt town militia quarantine. Reverend Lewis abhors the sight of his vindictive stake-burnt daughter Mercy, hell-bent on revenge with a witch-ally.—KGF Vissers
